org.threadly.concurrent.lock
Class StripedLock

java.lang.Object
  org.threadly.concurrent.lock.StripedLock

public class StripedLock
extends java.lang.Object

This structure allows for more controlled levels of parallism. It helps in allowing threads to only lock when their interest are the same. It is guaranteed that every key provided will return the same lock. But it is not guaranteed that two different keys will not have the same lock.

Constructor Detail

StripedLock

public StripedLock(int expectedConcurrencyLevel,
                   LockFactory lockFactory)
Constructs a new StripedLock with a given expected concurrency level. The higher the concurrency level, the less lock contention will exist, but more locks will have to be synchronized on and more memory will be used to store the locks.

Parameters:
expectedConcurrencyLevel - expected level of paralism
lockFactory - factory to produce new locks from
Method Detail

getExpectedConcurrencyLevel

public int getExpectedConcurrencyLevel()
Returns:
the constructed level of concurrency

getLock

public VirtualLock getLock(java.lang.Object key)
Call to get a striped lock for a given key.

Parameters:
key - to use hashCode() from to determine lock
Returns:
consistent VirtualLock for a given key

getLock

public VirtualLock getLock(int hashCode)
Call to get a striped lock for a given hash code.

Parameters:
hashCode - to use to determine which lock to return
Returns:
consistent VirtualLock for a given hash code
